TopicTitle: [v1.3!] Silisko Industries Doughnut Research & Spacecraft Development

Articles.Content:
I've been experimenting with different engines and tanks. I put a stock LFR under your 2m tank with a CC and 1m-2m shroud and that sucker went to 38km and burned for 2:20 on about 75% power.

Note to self: nerf new parts
@ dumbo13 need to unrar the rar files sometimes zip software wont pick up rivals zips so you have to tell it to open it with...[zip software of your choice]
Yeah, +1 request for a 2m to 3m adapter, from either you or Sunday, so we can thoroughly abouse both these excellent part packs.
2-3 adapter almost done.

Is anyone else having problems with the 2 meter parts not loading correctly from saves?

To me it just says it's missing parts, but the part names all match up in the save file.

I've only tested it with the 2to1 and the 2meter fuel tank, my friend was also having the same problem.

Because I was wondering if anyone else here was having this problem, as in both our cases it's the same parts.

Love this pack, one of the best on the site.

Nose cone parachutes are more useful than anything in the world

Holy hell, how much fuel did you pack into the 2m fuel tank?

I put one of Sunday's medium LFRs under it with a CC on top and it hit 132km at burnout 3:02 later. In the next 90 seconds it hit 478km, and it broke 1000K at 10:40.
Yeah might tone that down...
Hey nova, i remember you from the JC2 Forums haha

Yeah might tone that down...

Actually it's more the fault of the MedLFR, your tank burned twice as long as a stock tank w the Med LFR, but the MLFR went 46km on a stock tank. It's just insanely efficient.

Your tank is twice the Dia of the stock tank so it should have 4x the fuel not counting the increase in height as well (less a small amount)

Just for yucks I put 5 of them on top of Sunday's 3m quad LFR and it hit 55km at burnout T+2:15 and coasted another 100km in the next minute.
What.

man, this is a great set of parts! awesome, really

may i add a quick suggestion - we could use a 2M-to-1M reverse adapter, so we can build rockets like these

keep up the good work, this one sure is a doosie! :cheers:

man, this is a great set of parts! awesome, really

may i add a quick suggestion - we could use a 2M-to-1M reverse adapter, so we can build rockets like these

keep up the good work, this one sure is a doosie! :cheers:

<3

Will do on the reverse adapter. Probably going to make a hollow, decoupling nosecone to cover up the capsule too.

What.

derp

Indeed, the Ares I was about exactly what I wanted the 2-1 for.

By the way, there's something weird about that larger SRB you made - the thrust seems to drop off dramatically shortly after launch, but well before burnout.

Also: Saturn V is now complete (mostly):

Is anyone else having problems with the 2 meter parts not loading correctly from saves?

To me it just says it's missing parts, but the part names all match up in the save file.

I've only tested it with the 2to1 and the 2meter fuel tank, my friend was also having the same problem.

Because I was wondering if anyone else here was having this problem, as in both our cases it's the same parts.

Myself and two friends have also been having this problem.

Also, I assume you plan to make a few 2 meter shroud decouplers? Would be pretty boss. Also, a 3 meter cluster of 5 small engines would be pretty neat, like the second stage on a Saturn V.
Same here. I'm getting those errors with 2m parts.

loading problems - check!

here too... no idea what could be causing it - maybe HarvesteR knows - it shows an error on the rocket-name thingy, then everything freezes :
That's damn strange. Maybe it doesn't like underscores?
It isn't the underscores - I have a few other mod parts with underscores (e.g. the triple parachute) and those load just fine.
The 1-2 adapter shows up in the Propulsion pane and not under Structure/Aero where it should, is that something you can change in the next release?

Dude, please fix this problem.

I lost one of my Orbital space craft, built it again. loaded up another, only to re loud that one. Nothing, froze my game again with another hour of work lost. ;-;
I seriously don't know what's wrong. I can't find anything that could be causing it.

Didnt you do a re-texture in the lastest version?

the last version seemed to work fine for me. 0.3

I fixed it despite not knowing how to fix it. Thank you SKUNKY MONKEY wherever you may roam.

Also, updated to 0.5

I fixed it despite not knowing how to fix it. Thank you SKUNKY MONKEY wherever you may roam.

Also, updated to 0.5

My pleasure. I chased that bug around for a day myself. I forgot who pointed my error out.

Cheers!

Skunky
